question.title: Use Spark ML in Scala using Spark Connect
question.body:
I want to use Spark ML APIs in my already existing Scala project using Spark Connect to remotely execute the code in Spark clusters. When I try to import org.apache.spark.ml it doesn't exists. I am using Scala 2.13 with Spark Connect Client JVM 4.0.0. Am I missing something?

My SBT looks like this

ThisBuild / version := "0.1.0-SNAPSHOT"

ThisBuild / scalaVersion := "2.13.16"

lazy val root = (project in file("."))
  .settings(
    name := "ml"
  )

libraryDependencies ++= Seq("com.typesafe" % "config" % "1.4.3",
  "org.apache.spark" %% "spark-connect-client-jvm" % "4.0.0"
)


javaOptions += "--add-opens=java.base/java.nio=org.apache.arrow.memory.core,ALL-UNNAMED"

Also I have tried adding "org.apache.spark" %% "spark-mllib" % "4.0.0" to libraryDependencies and in doing that I am getting this error A master URL must be set in your configuration

answers.body:
Adding libraryDependencies += "org.apache.spark" %% "spark-mllib" % "4.0.0" (libraryDependencies += "org.apache.spark" %% "spark-mllib" % "4.0.0" % Provided if you do sbt assembly before spark-submit) sounds good. This makes packageorg.apache.spark.ml available.

Regarding A master URL must be set in your configuration try to add

.config("spark.master", "local")

or

.master("local")

(in code)

or

--master "local"

(in command line).

See details in Spark - Error "A master URL must be set in your configuration" when submitting an app
